docs.lead_paragraph: ARRIVAL OF THE SAXONIA.--The Steamship Saxonia, from Hamburg and Southampton on the 6th instant, arrived at this port yesterday morning. Her advices are anticipated by the simultaneous arrival of the Arago, which brought one day's later news. The excursion up the Mediterranean seems to have been abandoned, not more than half a dozen berths having been taken up to the 14th.

docs.lead_paragraph: HEALTH OF CHARLES SUMNER.--Our Washington correspondent writes as follows in a letter just received, in regard to the health of Mr. SUMNER: " Don't be alarmed by the reports in regard to Mr. SUMNER now afloat in the papers. He has been slightly indisposed, but is about as well now as when he reached here two weeks since. On last Wednesday, while in the Congressional Library,

docs.lead_paragraph: In the United States Senate yesterday, memorials were presented form citizens of New-Orleans and Philadelpbia. and from the Chamber of Commerce of the former city. asking aid for the Collins steamers. The deficiency bill was considered, but nothing was done with it. A bill for the relief of the chaimans in the case of the privateer brig General Armstrong was reported form the commistee on Foreign Relations.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE NATIONAL QUARENTINE CONVENTION.-The Board of Health yesterday appointed a Committee to attend the National Quaractine Convention, in Baltimore, on the 29th inst, and it is said the Chamber of Commerce will also send delegates to attend the Convention, so that the interests of this City will be properly represented on the occasion.

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM MEXICO.; Capture of Celaya by the Government Force.-- Rout of the Coalition--Surrender of Parrodi at Guadarajara--Term of Capitulation--Flight of Juarez--The War near Vera Cruz Ma??acres in Yucanan Withdrawal of the Exequaturs of Foreign Consuls--The War at Tampico.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the steamship Tennessee, at New-Orleans, we have received advices from the city of Mexico to the 1st, and from Vera Cruz to the 7th, inst. At the date of previous advices, the Zuloaga forces, under OSOLLO, and those of the coalition, then commanded by Generals PARERDI and DUBLADO, were concentrated at and near Celaya.

headline.main: Yellow Fever on the Susquehanna--Commander Sands arrested for Violating the Quarantine Laws.

docs.lead_paragraph: Doctor WALKER. Deputy Health Officer of the Port, appeared on Saturday before Justice WELSH, at the Lower Police Court, and made an affidavit, charging Captain SANDS. Commander of the United States steam frigate Susquehanna, with violating the quarantine laws.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the U.S. States on Saturday, the Deficiency bill was ma?? special order for to-day at 12 1/2 o'clock. M. B. N AMIN of Louisiana made a motion to postpone the further consideration of the Pacific Rail road bill until December, which motion, after an earnest debate, was carried, 25 to 22. In the House, the greater part of the session was consumed in the consideration of private bills.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE FRIGATE BENT BELOW--THE SICK TO THE MARINE HOSPITAL--A POLICE FORCE DETAILED TO QUARANTINE. Yesterday, at an early hour, Dr. THOMPSON, the health officer of the port, sent a communication to the Mayor staling the situation of the Susquehanna and her crew, and stating that, with the concurrence of the Mayor and Health Commissioners, he should send her to the Lower Bay. The following is a copy of the letter:
